text: don't worry cool Abu Hamza is a rebel
commander on the front near the Syrian
city of Hama he coordinates with his
scattered fighters however he can
sometimes on skype his brigade is part
of a fighting group called off fight al
Rasool the grandsons of the Prophet part
of a rebel coalition fighting on a new
front south toward Hama with an ambition
of bypassing the city and reaching Homs
fighting the forces loyal to President
Bashar al-assad has exacted a bloody
toll and not just on his men this is CJ
chippers reporting for The New York
Times
while many foreign governments worried
about chemical weapons the conventional
war in Syria has claimed tens of
thousands of lives and settled into a
near stalemate rebels hold much of the
countryside and sections of the road
between cities government troops are
entrenched on bases and in population
centers each side has launched its
offensives with the onset of warm
weather on the agricultural plains north
of Hama government forces punish
civilians and seek rebels with artillery
air and rocket attacks this pair nearly
hit a farmer grandsons one of the
largest rebel formations in the area one
of the officers visits villages where in
April and May the rebels drove out
government troops arriving earlier the
rebels hope on the Hama front had been
to create a new corridor to Homs and
find opportunities to cut the heavily
defended highway between Damascus and
Aleppo and choke the government supplies
these places from where the military
shells villages Arlo's if the rebels
succeed on the hama front there could be
relief here from this bitter breed of
war a mix of incremental gains and
bloody betrayal by early June government
forces began a counter-offensive
northeast of hama using tanks to reclaim
one of the towns without anti-tank
weapons rebels said their casualties
were high driving losses to more than
130 dead since the offensive began six
weeks ago the Hama front was at risk of
stalling - even as rebels said that they
had success forcing the army to react to
their advance in a war now in its third
year
